title: Nourishing Your Body
description: Food is fuel. Understanding nutrition helps you make conscious choices that boost energy, improve mood, and support long-term health. It's not about restriction, but about abundance of the right things.
sentences: Focus on a balanced plate: 1/2 vegetables, 1/4 protein, 1/4 complex carbs.
Prioritize whole, unprocessed foods over packaged items.
Meal prepping on weekends can save time and prevent unhealthy choices during the week.
Hydration is key; aim for at least 2-3 litres of water a day.
Understand your body's hunger and fullness cues.
dos: Learn to cook a few simple, healthy meals you love.
Read nutrition labels to understand what's in your food.
Incorporate a variety of colorful fruits and vegetables.
Eat mindfully, without distractions like your phone or TV.
donts: Don't label foods as 'good' or 'bad'; focus on balance.
Don't rely on sugary drinks for energy.
Don't go grocery shopping when you're hungry.
Don't follow fad diets that promise quick, unsustainable results.
